property.name: occurrenceID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the occurrenceID globally unique.

property.name: taxonID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of taxon information (data associated with the Taxon class). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: eventID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

property.name: institutionCode
property.dc:description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

property.name: collectionCode
property.dc:description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

property.name: catalogNumber
property.dc:description: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

property.name: sex
property.dc:description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: lifeStage
property.dc:description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: reproductiveCondition
property.dc:description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: behavior
property.dc:description: A description of the behavior shown by the subject at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: establishmentMeans
property.dc:description: The process by which the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence became established at the location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

property.name: occurrenceRemarks
property.dc:description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

property.name: individualCount
property.dc:description: The number of individuals represented present at the time of the Occurrence.

property.name: preparations
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen.

property.name: fieldNotes
property.dc:description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the Event.

property.name: samplingProtocol
property.dc:description: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event.

property.name: samplingEffort
property.dc:description: The amount of effort expended during an Event.

property.name: recordedBy
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (recordNumber), should be listed first.

property.name: identifiedBy
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.

property.name: dateIdentified
property.dc:description: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

property.name: eventDate
property.dc:description: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

property.name: modified
property.dc:description: The most recent date-time on which the resource was changed. For Darwin Core, recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E)

property.name: locality
property.dc:description: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.

property.name: decimalLatitude
property.dc:description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

property.name: decimalLongitude
property.dc:description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

property.name: verbatimLatitude
property.dc:description: The verbatim original latitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

property.name: verbatimLongitude
property.dc:description: The verbatim original longitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

property.name: verbatimElevation
property.dc:description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.
